alert.note: Alert for Castro; Lamb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 7:47PM CDT until May 31 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BAILEY...SOUTHEASTERN PARMER...SOUTHWESTERN CASTRO AND WESTERN LAMB COUNTIES... At 747 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles northwest of Sudan, or 10 miles southwest of Earth, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Muleshoe, Earth, Sudan, Amherst and Lazbuddie. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
